instructions:
Fry bacon till crisp, then crumble and set aside. Melt stick of margarine and sauté sliced onions
uncovered over medium/low heat for about 20 minutes or until tender. Stir as needed so as not to burn.
Drain onions of excess margarine and set aside.
Turn on oven to 450 F and heat a cookie sheet. Beat the eggs until lemon colored and blend in sour
cream, salt, pepper, Worcestershire and Tabasco.
Spread onions in bottom of pie shell and scatter crumbled bacon over onions. Pour egg mixture over
onions and bacon. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese over filling and bake at 450 F on cookie sheet for 15 minutes.
Reduce temperature to 325 F and continue baking for 10 to 15 minutes or until set in center. If crust gets too
dark, shield edge with foil. 
*(Rev. 6/1/97)*
ingredients: 2 lb Vadalia (or other sweet) onions, sliced 1/8 inch and halved
name: Onion Pie
creator: Ralph Yeager
